basics.name: Tanay Sharma
basics.summary: Hardware engineering student. Focus on chip design - computer architecture, VLSI design. Secondary focus on embedded systems and hardware security.

work.name: Institute for Advanced Study, Princeton University
work.summary: Teaching at Palmer Physical Laboratory (now 302 Frist Campus Center). While not a professor at Princeton, I associated with the physics professors and continued to give lectures on campus.

courses: Computer architecture, VLSI design, Digital Signal Processing, Microarchitecture

awards.title: Ernest W. Reynolds Scholarship
awards.awarder: University of Michigan College of Engineering
awards.summary: Awarded to students based on academic excellence in Electrical Engineering

awards.title: Clara E. Mara Scholarship
awards.awarder: University of Michigan College of Engineering
awards.summary: Awarded to students who demonstrate academic excellence and leadership in engineering.

projects.name: Quantum Computing
projects.summary: Quantum computing is the use of quantum-mechanical phenomena such as superposition and entanglement to perform computation. Computers that perform quantum computations are known as quantum computers.
